result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin James Maben

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devin James Maben in court.  
Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Devin James Maben.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Status Conference. 
Defense in receipt of defendant's new contact information and request another status date. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.
Received and filed: Justice Point STATUS Report.

Defendant Devin James Maben in court.  
Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Devin James Maben.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference. Defense request an additional date to determine the direction of the case. 
Court advises the defense this is the last adjournment for a Status and if  there is no resolution this matter will be set for Jury Trial.
Status Conference scheduled October 13, 2022 at 8:30am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services STATUS Report received and filed.

Defendant Devin James Maben in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  
Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini under the superviseion of Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM.  Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
State advises the court discovery was turned over to defense on 7-13-2022 and an offer sent today via email. 
Defense request time to retrieve and review with the client. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. 
Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Devin James Maben in court by video with Attorney Katherine Graber who appears in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer C. Boyack. Court took judicial notice of 15CF2467. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Devin James Maben in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Devin James Maben in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devin James Maben appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 3312 North 12th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
